website_summaries.verdict: A unique, durable Sabrent USB hub designed to be portable and useful for multimedia storage devices.
pros: Hub provides 3 USB 3.0 ports for charging devices or using accessories
Multicard reader supports various SD, CF, MMC, and M2 card formats
Aluminum exterior is tough and durable
cons: Data transfer speeds of the card reader vary depending on the card format and size of files

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if the CF card reader worked ..
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful for this product. I often need a card reader and portable USB hub. However, the CF card read does not work. I tried with three different cards. The SD card reader is fine. I don't own a Mirco SD card so can not comment. I am returning this product to Amazon. <<<<< Update >>>>>> Sabrent contacted me after seeing my review. We tried to work the problem, I did try the card upside down etc. to no avail. They were kind enough to provide me with a replacement and this reader works great.
customer_reviews.author: An average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Mine won't read CF cards
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking product with some flaws. SD card inserts only partially, and takes a little getting used to. The CF slot doesn't work at all. I tried flipping the card, trying several different cards of various capacities, and none of them were recognized on my Mac. I'm returning it since CF is the medium that I use the most, so if it can't read these, it's not of much use to me. Poor execution of what could have otherwise been a great product.
customer_reviews.author: VeloGeek

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice neat little package that never worked properly: It has multiple ports and card slots including one for a CF card. I thought this would be just the thing to couple with my Mac as I'm a professional photographer. It turns out I was wrong. The CF card reader part never worked with any of my cards on any of my computers. the manufacturer has sent me two replacements after three months of endless e-mails and delays - none of them have worked. i will have to battle this out to get a refund I'm sure. My advice is stay away form this product and manufacturer - they sell defective products and mislead the customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E Geiger

customer_reviews.title: USB ports for the iMac are very inconveniently located
customer_reviews.text: So far, this USB hub and card reader has worked quite well. The USB ports for the iMac are very inconveniently located, so extending a few to a more reachable place was needed. The brushed finish matches the iMac quite well. My camera also uses Compact Flash cards, so having an additional reader has been nice. You do have to insert it upside down, but so far it hasnt failed or corrupted any cards. My only complaint with this is that the LED light is on so long as the computer is on, even when the computer is asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Ray P

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I have been STRUGGLING with having to use a cheap, plastic USB multi card reader for years! Now that my needs have increased, and I not only needed a faster card reader, but wanted one that didn't flake out one, I luckily found this one! I wanted one that had three things, One, an aluminum case, two, was USB 3.0, and three, had a heavy duty USB cord attached so I didn't get somewhere where I needed to use it and had no cable to hook it up with. This one fit the bill and at only 20 dollars, was PERFECT! I may even order a second one for use at home and to have as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Not much else needs to be said about this little unit: it works. I've tried a couple of different card readers and this one is the best one yet. Mostly because it comes with a cord long enough to fit all the way around my 27" iMac. Plus, everything fits easily into the unit. I've struggled with others because they were more concerned with compact size than usability. This little unit is perfect. And, while it's larger than all the others, I'll take usability over space every time. It's great. It's quiet. It's affordable. And, it works. What more do you want...?
customer_reviews.author: JCAdmore

customer_reviews.title: You will have connection problems with this hub
customer_reviews.text: The device is great looking and I really wanted it to work. BUT... I have a blue tooth mouse and keyboard which use dongles plugged in the USB hub and had bad problems with both. I previously had a simple USB 3 hub and had no problems but when using this hub the keyboard experienced significant degradation. Type a key, wait 3 seconds and then it shows up. I believe the hub is generating some type of electrical interference affecting connected devices. I will try returning this one and getting another and hope I just got a bad one. I'll let you know.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, but ejects devices a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with My MacPro (late 2013 - black cylinder) and although I've had it for a while now, I'll have to move on to something else. This device has always had the issue of ejecting connected drives when I connect another drive to one of it's USB port. It's taken me a long time to research this issue and have found nothing definitive yet. My MacPro USB ports are perfect order. Once drives are plugged into this it work just fine. However if I have something plugged into it already, then add a USB device or remove one, it ejects the already connected one. I am typically using this for small mobile drives by the way.
customer_reviews.author: tangierc

customer_reviews.title: Good looking multi-reader that works on PC too!
customer_reviews.text: Personal Experience: My desktop did not have a MicroSD or SD card reader so I needed to get something. This was cheaper than a bay and easier to install because I had room on my desk. I like the look even though they target Apple users, but if you are a PC user I would highly suggest. Recommend: Yes Pros: Looks good Easy install Doesn't take up much room Small and easy to transport if using with a laptop Cons: Cord is shorter so think about placement if you are using on a desk
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Goede

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Properly, Impractical Design.
customer_reviews.text: The SD card reader never worked from day one and the MiniSD card reader only works about half the time. Beyond that, the angle of the face and the position of the MiniSD Card slot makes it nearly impossible to get the MiniSD card out without having long fingernails or tweezers. The USB ports are upside down which is not a big deal for most thumb drives but plugging in devices leaves the displays facing the ground. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campos

customer_reviews.title: Randomly disconnects even when transferring files.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design and the fact that it wasn't just a card reader, but also had 3 USB ports. This reader isn't powered, but maybe it should be. It kept randomly disconnecting even though I only connected one SD card. It would disconnect even when transferring files. I'm returning it for a different (probably powered) reader. I'm disappointed because I've usually had good experiences with Sabrent products.
customer_reviews.author: Nick A.

customer_reviews.title: Freezes my PC when plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: Froze my PC when I plug it in. Windows 7 and Windows 10, tried in both. This one says in description will work in MAC and any PC, but not it does not. I am an IT person, not an average user. Looked for a driver to fix problem, none to be found. I would avoid this for PC, might work fine in MAC, no idea.
customer_reviews.author: greatbigred

customer_reviews.title: Trash product
customer_reviews.text: Does not read more than one card at once. CF cards have to be put in upside down. If you have an SD card in and are working with it, then put in a CF card, it force ejects the SD card (really upsetting if you're working on it), and they will not read any cards at all. Basically, you have to eject one card and put in another. How stupid is this! So stupid to have 3 ports (not including USB) and you can only use one at a time. Complete trash. $4 card readers can do this.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for everything to work ** and just requested an RMA because this is way too hard for something that should work
customer_reviews.text: My wireless moused started working sporadically when I plugged this into the Mac. Moving the mouse's USB adapter to another port allowed for it to return to normal use, but frustrating. As several others have commented, the Compact Flash port did not work for any of my cards. However, the SD and Micro worked correctly. Opening a ticket hopefully for some resolution. Also, the fact that the reader can only pick from 1 card slot at a time is annoying. While the reader looks like a finish / quality of a Mac, can't say I'm impressed with a piece of hardware many companies have been getting right for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: This device is nicely designed, especially when hooked up next to an iMac. Aesthetics aside, it simply doesn't work dependably. While the three USB-3 ports seem to always work, the card readers are another story. The full-size SD card reader works about 50% of the time, the micro SD card reader, maybe 25%. If you look at my photo, I actually have an Insignia (Best Buy) card reader plugged in to one of the Sabrent's USB ports in order to reliably read SD cards. Wish I could say it was worth the money, but it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: mtbRoadie

customer_reviews.title: For my laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have an older laptop with only one USB 3.0 slot. This gives me the 2 extras as well as card reader. My laptop card reader is right in front center, so not the best place for a lap. It reads every card I use. It's weighted so stays in place. My only issue is the wire coming from the back of the device looks like it has been twisted. I hope that's not a sign of a future wire break.
customer_reviews.author: Billyk

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: The product is ok.... If you have the card in the SD slot and plug in a USB into any of the slots, the SD card disconnects. You can only use one at a time not both which isn't good for someone who wants to backup their files. Once the SD card disconnects you actually have to physically disconnect and reconnect the back USB to the computer otherwise the SD slot won't work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: instant 3.0 USB connection. no fuss no issues just go
customer_reviews.text: there is nothing to DISLIKE. I OWN A 5 TB SSD SOLD BY SEAGATE. ON THAT SSD IS A 3 DAY CONFERENCE. VIDEO PRESENTATION SPECIAL TALKS, FROM ALL ACROSS THE WORLD FOREIGN LANGUAGE DUBED INTO ENGLISH READS THE DATA AND THE VIDEO FLAWLESS!!! ALL THE DATA ON THE SSD IS USB 3.0 FORMAT. NO JERKING IN THE PLAYBACK I WAS AMAZED. EACH DAY THE CONFERENCE WAS 5 HOURS IN THE AM AND 4 HOUR IN THE PM. FIRDAY, SAT, SUNDAY, ALL information was perfect
customer_reviews.author: espeaker

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this product
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this product, I am using a Mac Pro and every time for it to read a card I have to unplug it to another port and then it will read the card. If I plug the card into the reader before unplugging it and replugging it the Finder will freeze and for example one photo file the ETA will say 10 minutes and never copy over to my local drive. I have to force Quit Finder then eject the card unplug and plug it back in.. Not the way a card reader should work.. It should work in the same port an​ all times and read every card as fast as the port on the computer is.
customer_reviews.author: Gudmundur Ibsen

customer_reviews.title: Signal Transfer Issues - Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: Starting with the good first: The unit looks good and build quality is moderate. moderate because the cable is flimsy. Really bad quality. and that is it for the good. For the bad: There are signal transfer issues. Even though it says it is USB-3 it will have major signal transfer issues starting with mouse pointers lagging (if you have a Bluetooth mouse connected.) audio breaking is you have a microphone connected, you get the idea. Tried using sidecar with it by connecting my ipad with the mac through this port and it failed consistently and pretty spectacularly. It works, just not the way anyone would ever be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Som

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Product looks sharp on my desk. I like the angled front that makes access to the ports easy and neat. There is a small light at the bottom of the front that makes this look classy as well as easy to locate. Surface finish matches my HP Envy laptop. Data pass through seems just as fast as directly plugging int the computer, though I haven't measured it.
customer_reviews.author: GHMINI

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my computer has all the USB ports on the back. It has worked well for me. I have not had any huge files or high-speed demanding needs for it, so I can't attest to it's speed. But it is small and sits nicely under my monitor and I have been successful reading a SD card in it. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Manley

customer_reviews.title: A couple little design oddities but works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for several months now and I still use this on almost a daily basis! The USB ports are upside down which took a bit to get used to and at first the cable on the back due to the angle at which it comes out of the back of the unit has a tendency to prop up the unit not allowing it to be flush against whatever its sitting on. Now several months later it does indeed sit flat which is good. Overall it looks neat and clean and matches my setup quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kryptide

customer_reviews.title: Does not recognize devices after being ejected
customer_reviews.text: The cord is too short. The hub disconnects when you eject any of the media, which is inserted in it. To get it going again, you need to unplug the USB from the computer and plug it back in. Too much hassle for a sleek looking device. I will be purchasing another unit and this one will be going to Salvation Army or eBay. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Outlaw Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy device to have for my Mac Desktop computer, especially since my computer is up against a wall. The only issue I have is that the middle socket does not like one of my Apple charger cords when connected to my iPad. It will change my iPhone but not my iPad, strange. Other than that, this has been a useful device and has functioned well, I have not tried the camera crd insert yet but I will and update if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: TexasBlingMommy

customer_reviews.title: Great for small form desktops
customer_reviews.text: Most desktops these days (especially custom builds) do not have card readers, and often they have a limited number of front USB ports. This design fits easily on the desk, it is powered by the USB cable, and the aluminum body matches my monitor stand, so it looks like it belongs there. There is a black one too if you would rather have that.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: random disconnects when a second device is plugged in...
customer_reviews.text: Randomly disconnects devices plugged into the USB port whenever an additional accessory is plugged into another port. I'm running High Sierra and have to unmount whatever I have plugged in before I plug anything else, defeating the purpose and convenience of having 3 USB ports. This random disocnnects also happen if I insert an SD card while something is plugged in a USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Kwisatz Haderack

customer_reviews.title: Great HUB
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for CF Card reader because transferring the photos directly from the camera takes so long. I was so happy to find this product. It has 3 USB ports, CF Card Reader and SD and micro SD card reader. The transferring speed is many times faster than using a USB cable from Camera (canon 5s classic). In additional, it look really cool with my MacBook Pro and wood Ikea table :)
customer_reviews.author: Artem

customer_reviews.title: Life is easier now!
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long to get one of these!!?? I use an iMac and this device makes reading SD cards so much easier instead of having to plug one into the slots on the back of the screen. I can also use it to charge other devices using the USB ports. This little port is elegant and the same color as my imac.
customer_reviews.author: outdoorsgirl

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! It won’t read memory cards and memory stick at the same time. Either one or the other.
customer_reviews.text: Every time I have a SD or CF card plugged in and later insert a memory stick the cards disconnect and vice verse. Very frustrating. it will automatically eject the thumb-drive or memory card whichever was previously inserted without permission and I always get message; Disk Not Ejected Properly... this device will eventually ruin my iMac. every time my iMac goes to sleep i get a lot of messages about the card not being ejected properly this is a waist of money. DONT BUY. your computer is not worth damaging by using this garbage, I want my money back
customer_reviews.author: TTB

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy, then toast
customer_reviews.text: Card Reader was hit and miss for reading on my new windows 10 Dell. Had my mouse wireless transmitter plugged into it and mouse would lag. Switched to usb plug on computer and it worked fine. Then after a couple weeks light started blinking and was getting continual audio signal that usb device was just plugged in. This would not stop. Disconnected and audio notification stopped. Tried other devices on that same usb plug this port was plugged into and they all worked fine so I can only conclude the port is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Wadeorcas

customer_reviews.title: Decent hub but not particularly well made or robust.
customer_reviews.text: Despite what it looks like this isn't metal. Its mostly plastic. That isn't really a big deal. What is was that after about 5 weeks the flash card reader part of this hub quit working. The SD card reader works sometimes but the CF card reader is totally dead. The USB ports work fine. I also note that this does get warm to the touch even though it is drawing power from the USB port and not an external source.
customer_reviews.author: I. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be solidly built and works as advertised. I have been using this with my ancient iMac and with a newer Acer Chromebook with zero issues. Having the extra USB ports is a bonus, especially when using it with my old Mac due to it not having many USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hacker

customer_reviews.title: item as described, serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This item was recommended by a friend. Good pick! While it cannot read cards/flash drives simultaneously - you can have two cards/flash drives in there and easily switch back and forth between them. The only "issue" I am having is that the cord is "trained" upside down from how the USB naturally fits into my computer. So i've had to kinda, wrap it around, so the base fits flat the way it supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Good USB... CF port poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: USB ports good. Cord is short. CF port was good but only for a short period. The way the hub is designed the CF is put in at an angle... but the guides don't hold an angle (you can tilt several degrees up or down). And, as you can imagine this quickly creates bent pins and problems. When I got a CF in it was fine but already (5 uses) the CF pins are useless and I spent way too much time with tweezers. For a CF reader I've found this one much better so far:
customer_reviews.author: MtDagny

customer_reviews.title: SD Card slots work, but...
customer_reviews.text: So, the SD Card slots work, but when you safely eject the inserted card and then insert another, you have to disconnect the USB from the back of your system and reattach it to get the computer to recognize a new card is inserted. Otherwise, it is working as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: CHARRY MONTES TOUSIGNANT

customer_reviews.title: Please note: This SD card reader needs a driver
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Can hold both SD and Micro SD Very nice design and materal Cons: USB cable only 1.5ft long Needs a driver. You have to use some software (e.g. Drivereasy) to get the drivers for this SD card reader. Otherwise if you select securely remove devices in Windows this reader would not work until you reboot or re-plug it, since windows thinks it's been removed. Also, you cannot simultaneously put a microSD and a standard SD in it which is kind of a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Dian Pan

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy photography so the media card slots were a welcome ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a more convenient location for usb ports on my computer. My monitor has them on the back and my computer case has them on the top where I'll need to stand up to plug anything in. With this I just plug it into the usb 3.0 port on the back of the monitor and have quick and convenient access to 3 ports. I enjoy photography so the media card slots were a welcome feature too so that I didn't have to rely on the slower transfer speeds using the usb port on the camera. The angle of the ports also make plugging and unplugging easier than hubs where they are front facing.
customer_reviews.author: JayVee

customer_reviews.title: it works, but definitely not 3.0 speeds
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this would be great, getting the USB 3.0 speeds and all, but sadly that isn't true. I have yet to see anywhere near 3.0 speeds, not even 2.0 speeds, I would say about close to max 1.0 speeds is what I am getting. I am using this plugged directly into one of the USB 3.1 port on the motherboard. Now, all the ports on the device function, but I am just not seeing the speeds one would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great SD reader replacement for iMac.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to replace my non-functioning SD reader on my iMac (a common problem, apparently). I didn't have any problems-- plug and play. Very nice to have the USB ports up front now, too. Looks nice, like it was made for the computer. One little surprise was how shallow the SD card fits into the slot. Not the normal depth on other readers. Doesn't seem to affect the function at all though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Crashes Lightroom Classic when attempting to import from a CF card. EVERY TIME.
customer_reviews.text: This was a flaky right out of the box. However, I needed a way to create more USB ports so I put up with it longer than I should have. Lightroom CC crashes every time I attempt to import from a CF card. I've tried several cards and several cameras. Also, the CF card goes in upside-down? That's just an accident waiting to happen. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A Great Card Reader, sold USB Functions, and Attractive Design to Enhance the Work Area of the the Computer
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mac and bought the Sabrent because of its looks and the joint functions of card reading and USB use. It is small , attractive looks like it made for the computer and performs very well. I shoot a lot of Raw Photos so the function of Card Transfer is very important. I have not had any problems and have used it for about 7 months. I Highly recommend this. Again the design of the unit really enhances the look on the desk. I also felt that the price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: AidenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product in theory...except in reality it doesn't really work on my 2015 Mac Mini. The Compact Flash reader is PAINFULLY slow, regardless of which of my 5 CF cards I try (see screen cap of moving 1.2GB of photos to hard drive). Plugging in a USB 3.0 external drive brings my entire system to a crawl. You can only plug one type of card in at time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Starmer

customer_reviews.title: SD etc fine, but it stopped working after a couple of ...
customer_reviews.text: Started off reading CF, SD etc fine, but it stopped working after a couple of months! Was working, now it's not. Light goes on but nobody home. Another different hub works fine so its the hub. 2016 MacBook Pro user. Too bad as this combo of CF etc is hard to find. Most DSLR users still use CF cards and manufacturers don't get that! So good hub design, but not functional.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I got a new computer and got it all setup before I noticed "No place to plug in my camera cards"! This little thing fixed it and gave me a few more USB ports as well. Much better constriction than I expected!!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin L.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Its at the end of a 3 stage USB chain and it works just fine. looks good, sturdy easy to move out of the way when not used and get close when needed. My stuff is usb 3.0 and it seems fast - no idea how I would verify that, just seems fast. what else do you say about such and item. Does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: WantinMoore

customer_reviews.title: NOT AN XQD READER
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive what I expected. I thought this unit would have an XQD reader as one of the ports. I specifically searched that description and sorted through many readers that I easily identified as non XQD readers. I needed This today as my old reader quit working. Pretty disappointed when I opened this box
customer_reviews.author: Sgthunter

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and seems to be built well
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and seems to be built well, but after using the microSD it got hot and burnt out on the first try. Also Windows 10(All is up to date) has a hard time recognizing it when plugged in and it takes several attempts to get it to link up. The other slots all work good, the USB ports, the SD port, no problems. But because it failed on the microSD and has a hard time linking to Win10, I just cannot recommend this product, but it is a great concept if it actually worked without the flaws.
customer_reviews.author: SoulD

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for micro SD cards, I was put off by some of the reviews but sure enough the MicroSD card reader doesn't work. The cable is also incredibly short. I am writing this off and getting something else that will do the job. Don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Thornton

customer_reviews.title: SD Card Reader DOA
customer_reviews.text: Odered this just for the SD and Micro SD card reader and it was DOA. All cards tested read just fine in my older USB 2.0 Dynex reader. This unit would not even show the card when plugged in. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Wrong side up is the right side up!
customer_reviews.text: I find the reviews that complained about a CF card being "upside down" while inserted comical. Why would anyone want to look down and see the CF product label? I think it very smart that the Sabrent was designed so that when you look down, you will see your personal and valuable notations you have used to identify the CF. On my iMac, these USB ports and the card reader work perfectly. The Sabrent is small and attractive. I highly recommend it. If you care about how cool and uncluttered your desk will look, you will love this.
customer_reviews.author: Kat n Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Convenient way to add USB ports and SD card slots. A good value too.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to add a few more USB ports to my iMac. It matches the finish of my iMac, and it makes it so much easier to plug things in, instead of reaching around the back of the machine. While I have only used the micro SD card slot once, that too was very convenient. A good value too.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Does not read Compact Flash cards
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased, exchanged and will now return another Sabrent card reader. These readers simply will not read a compact flash card. I could barely get my CF cards in the slot. Once I was able to get them in and firmly seated. I tested with multiple cards using the Sabrent reader and a Lexar reader. The Sabrent reader never worked with CF cards but the same cards inserted into a Lexar reader revealed my files almost immediately. I am only giving this reader one start because it does read an SD card and the USP ports seem to work OK.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Rincon

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Looks great. Good value. I’m happy. Honestly I was a little hesitant because of the low price and I am now very happy. And it makes life much easier than having to reach around the back of the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on my MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: At first, only the USB 3 ports worked on my MacBook Pro (OS 10.11). I went to Sabrent website and found their documentation and downloaded the zip file which contained a firmware update. After flashing the hubs firmware, all ports work as advertised. I can now use all ports. I also found that I can have my USB WiFi adapter in one of the USB ports and it works perfectly. I like that the UBS ports are spaced at a nice distance so that 3 wide USB devices can be used together. I could never use 2 USB flash drives on my Mac at the same time before.
customer_reviews.author: F. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, even better price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a clean, inexpensive, and solid media card reader for my mac. I wanted to be able to put it on my desk so that I'm not twisting the mac around to put SD cards from my DSLR in. All of the media card ports work and the USB is 3.0. Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a desktop card reader/USB hub (Powered my IOmega eGo with just one port connected)
customer_reviews.author: seth alton

customer_reviews.title: Does its thing quietly.  Too quietly.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do and in general doesn't get in your way in the process. Only two cons I'd mention are: 1) USB jacks are upside down so stuff like flash drives, etc. plug in with their logos, activity lights, etc. facing down. Still retraining myself to adapt to this. 2) It would be really nice if the card reader had an activity indicator of some sort. It's hard to tell when something is done writing to a card. Apart from these little peccadilloes, I like the design and it does its thing quietly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Don P.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on windows 10 as a 3.0 hub, only as a 2.0 hub
customer_reviews.text: This does not work on my windows 10 gateway laptop. If I plug it into a 3.0 port, it keeps connecting and disconnecting. It did work one time. Nobody at Microsoft had any ideas. I contacted Sabrent and all they said was to send it back to the seller. It does work when plugged into a usb 2.0 port. I bought a different manufacture's usb 3.0 hub (A patriot 4-port usb 3.0 hub) and that works flawlessly. I'll keep the item and use it as a 2.0 hub because returning it would be to much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: E. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cord keeps unit from laying flush
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I would give it a 5-star but the cord coming out of the back of the unit is poorly placed and it will not lay flat on my desk- as the cord impedes it from sitting flush (see picture)
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Fit and finish: Superb. It has good weight, so it won't be easily knocked around your desk. It is also very solid - doesn't feel creaky when you use it. Looks great, too! The angled approach makes it much easier to use without having to lift it off the desk or two-hand it. Performance: Very fast - informal benchmarking shows it maintains the same speed through this hub as if I used the usb port directly. Love the micro SD slot as well - finally able to use something without an easily lost adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Steve from Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: It stops working when transferring data for a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: The product looks great and installs easily. The USB ports work fine. However, the card reader is not working properly. Every time I insert an SD card and start transferring data from the card to my computer, after a certain amount of data, the device stops working. I have to disable it in the device manager and enable it again for it to work again. This is specially frustrating when copying a big folder from the SD card into the computer. It also happens with big files (e.g. video files). It's a real pitty because I liked the physical design, but it just can't work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Zarabozo

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, good quality. Gave me the additional expansion necessary with my new Intel NUC PC. I quickly ran out of USB ports and had no way to read my SD cards. Problem solved and it looks stylish sitting in front of my setup. The only issue I have is that it can only read one card slot at a time. I can't copy 2 cards in different slots directly to each other. I have to copy to the PC first, remove the card, insert the other card, then copy back. Luckily everything is SSD and USB 3 so everything is fast.
customer_reviews.author: kavlito

customer_reviews.title: Compact Flash gets HOT
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased an iMac and wanted a more accessible USB plus a memory card reader. The Sabrent looked like just want I needed. I am quite concerned about how hot my memory cards get if I leave them in longer than it takes to upload to my computer. I figure it's only a matter of time before they are fried. I also disliked how they insert upside down which doesn't make sense to me. I am not able to use more than one device at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela Delainey

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Good product, good company, good customer support!
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE* Sabrent Support contacted me again and sent a direct link to the file I needed and corrected the file error on their server. While I am not running El Capitan(OSX 10.11) on my Mac, I am on Yosemite(OSX 10.10.5) the fix for El Capitan did update the firewire and get the card reader operational, and lightning quick I must add. I don't expect companies to never have problems but how they handle them directly relates how large and loyal is their customer base. After dealing with them I would feel comfortable purchasing another of their products!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: This product has a short shelf life for sure
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is quality. At first it was great. After a while of looping the wires for easy travel, I discovered the constant bending created a short in the device. It's great to have those different ports.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hinkson

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE HUB...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it... This product makes my life so easy... Time to time, even with heavy DSLR you want to quickly shoot with your smart phone. Well, then you have to get the pictures out - this is ONE STOP SHOP deal - Plug my Flash Card, my micro SD, SDHC all cards and transfer to my USB drive with this unit ALL AT ONCE... With USB 3.0 connections Read/Write is super fast.... the build is solid and the attached cable is big plus... Looks very good and works just fine.... Thank you, Cheers!!!
customer_reviews.author: RichiPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and nice.
customer_reviews.text: So far am enjoying this functional 3.0 device. Based on reviews, I also purchased the A/C power adapter. Big mistake... there is no power plug on this device. I used the power adapter on a different device and decided not to return it. After all, it is a 5V adapter pushing 4 amps of current. Not bad. Back to the hub. What a screamer! I put two USB 3 hard drives in and did sync work between the drives. Nice and fast. Also, Windows 10 leaps into action in recognizing the drivesl Slick.
customer_reviews.author: plum_1000

customer_reviews.title: great portable thumb drive and SD card reader.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of video recording from devices and needed a card reader that was faster then what I currently had. I also wanted somthing that I could take with me if I travel. this fit the bill. it is small and works as a hub as well. I only use micro sd cards so don't know how fast the other card slot are. It is small enough to fit in my bag when I travel with out being bulky only down side is the attached cable is short probably only 12 inches so it is limited on reach.
customer_reviews.author: S. George

customer_reviews.title: CF Reader does NOT work with a Mac.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item specifically to work with a Mac and the CF Reader. It doesn't work. I contacted Sabrent support. They sent me a new item. It doesn't work either. The USB ports work fine, but the card reader is not recognized by either my MacMini or my MacBook Pro. I've spent hours trying to get it to work, but to no avail. I will be asking for a refund from Sabrent.
customer_reviews.author: Nick C.

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it works great and is pretty fast
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it doesn't read the CF card while a SD card is in the or vice versa. I noticed it after a couple uses that I had to take one out in order for it to read the other. Other than that it works great and is pretty fast. It could just be my device specific problem but that's the only reason for the 3 stars..
customer_reviews.author: Jayrald Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, feels good, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Thought he product does look good and it does have some heft to it, it does not work. The micro SD card reader works intermittently and the SD card reader does not work at all. After writing to the company and asking for help... I heard nothing back. I will return this product and find another solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Few short commings
customer_reviews.text: This product gives you easier access to USB ports and a card reader. For my PC location, this was a much simpler solution to hook peripherals into. The cord is short on it though, to the point where I needed to buy an extension cable as I keep this below my monitor. Also there is a white light on the front that is permanently on when your pc is on or asleep. I wish this could be turned off as i never shut my pc off, only put it to sleep. It light my office up enough where I can make out everything in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all to read CF cards on my IMac 2017. It’s a lemon. Also, it’s very difficult to insert and remove the CF card. Looks nice & seems to be built nice but that means nothing if it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: ArtTechie

customer_reviews.title: Ports for Days!
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically the product fits well with my MacBook with its close resemblance of an Apple product. Works well for the most part, I knocked off a star because there have been a couple of SD cards that have not been able to register on the device. The USB ports have worked perfectly, and as I mentioned before it keeps a streamlined look if that is something you are into. Some have complained about the cards having to fit in upside down, but in no way does that inhibit [from my personal experience at least] the use or impact performance of the product or card.
customer_reviews.author: SJN

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit that works well.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a convenient bub for use with the iMac. When you're using flash drives this makes life a whole lot easier than groping around on the backside of the Mac. Really?? No convenient USB ports? And since everyone needs somewhere to dump pictrues from their flash card (again lacking from the iMac, another problem solved! Silver color matches nicely, but not sure it really needs the blue light on the front... in your bedroom at night.
customer_reviews.author: RadioRick

customer_reviews.title: CF port doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the CF card reader, which doesn't work. The USB ports work fine, so I'm giving it a 2, rather than a 1 star review. Also, the USB ports generate lots of heat. Every thumbdrive I've had plugged in gets hot to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: MamaSparkleNerd

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive way to add flash drive reader to any computer
customer_reviews.text: A great way to add a flash drive reader to a computer. I was able to replace the USB extender that holds my receiver for my keyboard and mouse as well as add a flash driver reader in a single item. The light underneath also helps me to know if the computer is on or is shut down if I step away and the computer goes to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow device
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. It does not support multiple cards at once and the speed for writing on class 10 (HC I) SD card is about 200 Kb/s! Tried 3 cards and two computers. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Company replaced - ORIGINAL: Starts Great, then card reader stops working.  Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Oringinally gave this 4 stars. But a month and half in the card reader no longer works. Really disappointing. Recommend avoiding this one. Attached a video. This thing sucks. Contacted the seller, said they would replace. Update: And they did - and this one seems to work for now. I appreciate the quick replacement. Company is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Card reader operation is faulty
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into a USB outlet in the back of brand new iMac Pro, no cards were recognized int any of the slots.. Then I switched it to a different USB outlet and the two out of the 3 card slots worked, but not the CF one. I then switched the device to a Mac Air where only the USB extensions were recognized. So, I'm returning this.
customer_reviews.author: T0N1

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product but don't it expect it to power multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what it is designed for. It looks good and matches the aesthetics of my apple computer. This is not powered and should not be used with multiple non powered usb devices (for example you can definitely use a portable hard drive with this but you cannot use 2 portable hard drives without risking not having enough power for both and possibly losing connection from the computer to the hard drives.) The cf reader works well and as a whole the product works very well for what it is designed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander E Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with wireless mice and keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I have a wireless mouse and keyboard from Logitech that both have their own USB dongles that take up all TWO of my MacBook Pro's USB ports. Both devices behave erratically when plugged in to this hub. The mouse is jittery and the keyboard will delay many seconds or just stop working entirely until I unplug the hub and plug it back in. I tried just plugging in one device to the hub for testing but it didn't matter. Both devices work perfectly when plugged directly in to the computer. TL;DR DO NOT BUY THIS HUB FOR WIRELESS MICE OR KEYBOARDS
customer_reviews.author: Gil Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Will not read card in CF slot.
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review time after I purchased this item, it has been in functional use until now, satisfactorily. The reason I am giving it a low rate is because recently I got to test the CF card slot, and discover it does not work, it simply will not "see" my card once inserted. Update, Sabrent contacted me and sent me a replacement unit, which worked. I am giving them two more stars for that.
customer_reviews.author: Axolotl

customer_reviews.title: Not Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product. It did not work for me. I bought it to match my hub and MacBook. I basically use CF cards for my use. But when I inserted one in the Sabrent, it would not read it. I tried another, it would not read that one either. I tried a SD card, it read that no problem. Then I tried another CF card. Again, it would not read it. As a result I cannot recommend the Sabrent unit. It is not dependable.
customer_reviews.author: LaVell Finerson

customer_reviews.title: Corrupted my files
customer_reviews.text: Looks amazing and fits in on my desk but after a couple months of use it ended up corrupting my files that I transferred from a SD card to my computer. Not great since I used this at my desk at work and can't have this happening.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Not Without Problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hub for my iMac so I wouldn't have to use the ports on the back of the monitor. While this hub does allow the USB ports to be used with ease, the sd and cf card readers do not always read inserted cards immediately and I have had to unplug and replug the hub to read those cards.
customer_reviews.author: Dev Sin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent USB Port For iMac!
customer_reviews.text: I have an iMac OS X El Capitan Version 10.11.2. I needed some extra USB ports and this does the trick. Easy to use, just plug it in. Looks great with my iMac and added bonus I have extra memory slots as well. I have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: TulsaDreamer

customer_reviews.title: Junk - lasted 4 months and about 30 uses, then the card readerS stopped working
customer_reviews.text: If looks were everything, this would be a 4 star, however, FUNCTION is much more important and since this stopped working after about 30 uses, I call it junk. No SD or CF reader and 1 of the USB ports won't communicate with my computer. Unplugged and replugged, rebooted, etc. dead. Don't buy unless you only need it for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jumping Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Just got a new iMac and thought this would be a great addition as it can sit on the base and uses the 3 cards I use for my photography. Plugged it in and found it can only read 1 card at a time. If you put another card in, it ejects the other one. Not worth it. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: A. Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Carful with the micro SD slot
customer_reviews.text: The Micro SD slot tends to allow the card in wrong. The rest is good. Keep a pair of tweezers handy to get the card out when you push it in wrong.
customer_reviews.author: 1995Wrangler

customer_reviews.title: Works great and loaded the images from my SD card very ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and loaded the images from my SD card very quickly. Only complaint would be that if you have a MacBook Pro and you need this device due to a lack of USB ports, as I did, you will still need to buy the USB to USB-C required for the new MacBook. No reflection on the product I just figured that's who was purchasing this device since the new MacBook is USB-C only. $9 purchase at the Apple Store and I was in business. Amazon has it for $28 for some bizarre reason.
customer_reviews.author: V. C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep on hand.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these on 2 machines, and they work great. Good, long cord means no more searching the tower for the card reader and ports. And with a Mac Pro, it's essential for camera cards and USB drives. I keep one in my bag too, because I never know what I'll walk into on a job.
customer_reviews.author: Church Sound Guy

customer_reviews.title: And when I plug in a new item it ejects all the other connected items then reconnects them which isn’t good for the drive
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Card CF card reader only works if nothing else is plugged in. And when I plug in a new item it ejects all the other connected items then reconnects them which isn’t good for the drive. Addendum: I purchased another one thinking maybe I just had poor luck with the first purchase... the second one is the same. Will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmosrn

customer_reviews.title: Nice, looks great, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and looks good. My only gripe is that the cable is really short, making it hard to integrate into my desktop system. I can also see the benefit of a short cable, though, so I only really want to dock 0.5 stars for that. If Sabrent could offer a model with its short cord and one with a full 6-8 foot cord, that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Aladdin

customer_reviews.title: 4 months later, product breaking down.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I loved it in the beginning! Worked flawlessly It has been almost 4 months and the product is starting to break (see photo). I bring it to work everyday so I have to wrap the cord around the body, and now this has happened. Would be beneficial if the cord could disconnect from the hub to prevent this from occurring.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Canon Digital Rebel!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, good quality product. It worked well with my Canon digital Rebel and yes, it did make download process much faster! I will say that it took me some time to get the card to fit in the larger slot. I thought I bought the wrong product/card size, but I was trying to insert it wrong, and glad that my daughter in law tried it (and figured out that it was a 'user error' ). :) Very nice product!
customer_reviews.author: D3ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Although it has multiple USB and card slots, you can only use one USB and one card at a time. I figured it was malfunctioning but sadly, found out it wasn't. Dont make my mistake. I didn't find out in time to return this hub but still had to buy a new hub.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Works great...for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I read and burn a lot of SD and uSD cards as part of my job. After 6 months, and about 10 uses, the uSD card reader stopped working. I could live with this as I can still use the SD card slot with an adapter. Well, another 6 months later, and that just stops working too. The USB3 ports still work, but I really need the card reader. So, I give it 3 stars - worked great in the beginning, but is not durable. So, back to Kingston - I have a 5 year old USB2 reader from them, and it still works great. I just want/need the higher speeds available with USB3.
customer_reviews.author: AmbienWalrus

customer_reviews.title: This item does not read CF cards
customer_reviews.text: I thought I liked everything about this reader and then I tried to put a CF card in the slot...was very hard to do so. Then the worst happened...ZERO! Would not read my card. I tried everything ten times. ZERO! What is going on? The back story is quite long so I won't get into it but this purchase was very important so I could read my CF cards while I'm traveling but, absolutely NO DICE! And it said it worked on all MacBooks!!! Now what?
customer_reviews.author: David E. West

customer_reviews.title: Good except CF port doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: While the USB ports, micro SD, and SD ports work the CF port does not. I use all of these and really hoped that this would work all around. I use Mac and wanted to keep everything on my desk matching as much as possible, so when I found this I thought it would be great. I'm disappointed that the CF port doesn't work. I use it more than any other card, so I still have to use my old CF card reader. It's a pain and clutters my space up. Not what I had in mind.
customer_reviews.author: SassyTeslaLady

product_meta.title: Sabrent Premium 3 Port Aluminum USB 3.0 Hub with Multi-in-1 Card Reader (12" Cable) for iMac, All MacBooks, Mac Mini, or Any PC (HB-MACR)
product_meta.description: This Sabrent hub is an external USB 3.0 combo which combines USB 3.0 hub with super speed card readers. The USB 3.0 Hub adds three USB ports to your Mac (or PC), allowing you to connect USB devices such as digital cameras, phones, external hard drives, flash drives, and printers to one convenient place. Its sleek aluminum design the perfect complement to your Apple computer and products. It does not require any software or complicated installation process. With a slim design, it saves you precious desktop space. It's extremely portable and easy to move between systems or take on the road. Please Note:2.4Ghz wireless devices, such as wireless keyboard and mouse adapters, may not work in close proximity to USB 3.0 devices or hubs. Connecting to a USB 2.0 port is recommended. For a stable connection, the devices connected to the 3-Port USB 3.0 Hub must not exceed a combined current of 5 volts 900 mash. External hard-drives should be connected to an external power source. This 3-Port USB 3.0 Hub will not charge an iPad (it will only sync). Usage Tips 1. The device can read one card only in either slot every time. 2. It is recommended to remove safely after connection. System requirements: Mac OS 9.1 & higher. Windows 98SE /ME /2000 /XP /Vista /7/8.Linux 2.4 or above Package contents. USB 3.0 3-port hub. Warranty: This product comes with a one year warranty. In order for us to properly assist you, please follow these simple instructions: Go to .sab rent/support and click ‘Submit a ticket’. Submit your ticket. You must include your Order ID# number in the subject line.
feature_bullets: Sleek Apple-style design ideal For Mac Pro, iMac, MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, MacBook, and Mac mini
Instantly Add 3 USB 3.0 Ports to Your Computer With Speeds of 5Gbps (USB 3.0), 480Mbps (USB 2.0), 12Mbps (USB 1.1)
Supported Cards: CF, SD, SDXC, SDHC, MicroSD, MMC, M2
Easy to Setup, Plug-n-Play, Hot Swappable, Hot Pluggable

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,345 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
